quest.name: Back from the Wood
journal: Commander Heuloix appears to have more to say.

Mere moments after Commander Heuloix bids you send his regards to Minfilia, she contacts you via linkpearl. The Antecedent expresses relief that the matter of Ramuh has been laid to rest, and requests your presence at the Waking Sands.
After giving you a characteristically warm welcome, Tataru informs you that Minfilia is waiting in the solar. Enter at your leisure.

Minfilia's exposition is interrupted by a frightened yelp from without. Rushing to the source of the commotion, you find yourself face-to-face with the sylph Noraxia, who has come to offer her aid to the Scions. Safe in the knowledge that there is no cause for alarm, resume your conversation with Minfilia.
Though Minfilia is heartened by the continued growth of her “family” of Scions, she cannot help but wonder at the appearance of the Ascians. What might their presence portend?

dialogue.name: VORSAILE
dialogue.text: The sylphic folk have long been friends to Gridania. The mere thought of being at war with them pained the Elder Seedseer to no end.

dialogue.name: VORSAILE
dialogue.text: But owing to your efforts, she will be able to rest easier. Being the benevolent soul that she is, my lady will surely try to find a way to reverse the tempering process.

dialogue.name: VORSAILE
dialogue.text: Once again, I thank you. Had the Scions of the Seventh Dawn not offered to mediate between our peoples, suspicion and doubt may well have led us into needless conflict. Pray pass on my regards to Lady Minfilia.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: ...Hello? Hello, Forename? Can you hear me? It is I, Minfilia.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Yda and Papalymo returned some little while ago. And they wasted no time in regaling me with the tale of your exploits.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Thanks in large part to you, the name of one primal may be struck from our list of enemies, and the Gridanians may turn their attention to more pressing matters. Well done!

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Yet the end of one tale is but the start of another. Pray return to the Waking Sands at your earliest convenience. I would apprise you of the present situation in person.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: Well, if it isn't my favorite adventurer! Welcome back, Forename!

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: Lady Minfilia awaits you within the solar. Please enter at your leisure.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I am given to understand that the matter of Ramuh has finally been resolved.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Hm. I fear “resolved” bespeaks a permanence we cannot rightly claim. Yet I am well satisfied that the Lord of Levin will not trouble us in the foreseeable future.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Your satisfaction is assurance enough for me.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: How fares the investigation?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Well enough. Thancred is sparing no effort.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: They are many and one, just as you suspected. Their purpose, however, eludes us still.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: I see.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Ah, I have been meaning to ask, but is Alisaie quite well? I feel as if I have scarcely seen her in recent days.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Oh, you haven't─and nor have I, alas. Alisaie has chosen to walk her own path─stubborn girl─but you may be assured that our destination remains the same.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: And on that note, I take my leave of you. I trust the Baldesion report will serve you well.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: I take it we can proceed as discussed?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Why do you ask? You scarce need my permission to act.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: It is good to see you again, Forename!

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: I have been looking forward to congratulating you on your triumph in the Twelveswood. Owing to your efforts, conflict has been averted. Truly, you have done the Scions proud.

dialogue.name: PAPALYMO
dialogue.text: With that, we can strike Ramuh from the list.

dialogue.name: YDA
dialogue.text: So who's next? The Sahagin and Leviathan?

dialogue.name: PAPALYMO
dialogue.text: The Lord of the Whorl has not answered his minions' call of late, nor is he expected to do so in the near future.

dialogue.name: PAPALYMO
dialogue.text: While the Sahagin remain as aggressive as ever, they lack the quantity of crystals required to call forth their god. As with the sylphs, we can leave them to their own devices...for a time, at least.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: “For a time” bears repeating. We can ill afford to fall complacent.

dialogue.name: PAPALYMO
dialogue.text: It is as Y'shtola says. Unless we know the minds of the beast tribes, we cannot predict with any certainty when next a primal will return to plague the land.

dialogue.name: PAPALYMO
dialogue.text: This being the case, we must proceed with as much haste as prudence allows.

dialogue.name: YDA
dialogue.text: Any word on Titan?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: The Maelstrom keeps the kobolds under constant observation.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: We shall hear from them ere long, you may depend upon it.

dialogue.name: PAPALYMO
dialogue.text: Indeed. So, then─of all the known primals that have been active in recent times, we are left with...

dialogue.name: YDA
dialogue.text: Gridania! Wait, I meant Garuda─who is the primal of the Ixal who live near Gridania. Yes, that's what I meant.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: So many malms to cover... Would that there were a more efficient way to conduct our surveys.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Were he still with us, we should not long have wanted for a more practicable solution...

dialogue.name: BIGGS
dialogue.text: She's not wrong there... <sigh> Where in the world are you, Chief?

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: ...But one sure step at a time!

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Henceforth, the Order of the Twin Adder will handle all matters pertaining to the sylphs, under the sage guidance of the Seedseers.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: I bid you all enjoy a moment's respite. You have earned it!

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Is there something else, Forename?

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Beg pardon? A man named Lahabrea, sporting a red mask and robed in black...? Twelve preserve...

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Prior to the Calamity, the Ascians took great pains to remain hidden... Why would they choose to cast off their veil of secrecy now? Gods, this bodes ill...

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: We must take advantage of the present lull in primal hostilities and investigate this Lahabrea─learn all we can of him and his designs. I dread to thi─

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: EEEEEEK!

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Tataru!

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: A sylph...in Thanalan?

dialogue.name: NORAXIA
dialogue.text: At long last, this one finds walking one Forename!

dialogue.name: NORAXIA
dialogue.text: This one is most dependable of these ones! Is sent by elder one Frixio to help walking ones!

dialogue.name: NORAXIA
dialogue.text: This one is called Noraxia. This one comes as a friend. Let these ones be friends!

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: P-Pleasure to meet you...Noraxia.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Yes, Tataru is as ready to express her fright as she is to express...everything else! Not all of us are forged of the same steel as you, I'm afraid.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: But it takes all kinds to make a family, and it pleases me to no end to see ours continue to grow. One by one, the people of Eorzea are beginning to unite, Forename, drawn to the hope that shines within you.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Yet a darkness threatens to engulf this light. Never have I doubted the Ascians' presence, but that they have grown so brazen as to carry out their work in plain sight fills me with a sense of deep foreboding.
